New Records: Ronald Acuña Jr. became the first player in MLB history to have at least 40 homers and 70 stolen bases in a single season.
Key Match Events: Acuña singled to drive in the tying run with one out in the 10th inning, then stole second base for his historic 70th before scoring the winning run on Ozzie Albies' walk-off single.
The Cubs scored a run in the ninth, but Marcell Ozuna's ninth-inning homer tied the score again and forced extra innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Acuña said of reaching 40-70, 'I'd be lying if I said to you that I thought I was going to get this done, that I was going to be able to do it.'
Albies and Ozuna both said late Wednesday should assure Acuña wins the National League MVP award.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Acuña became the fifth member of the hallowed 40-40 club — at least 40 homers and 40 stolen bases in a season — Friday when he hit his 40th homer in a win at Washington.
Acuña is hitting.336 with 41 homers and 104 RBIs from the leadoff spot, leads the majors in both stolen bases and runs (146), and leads the NL with a 1.010 OPS.
Others: The game was played in 10 innings with a final score of 6-5 in favor of the Atlanta Braves.
